Xin Zhang

Ph.D Student

School of Computer Science, College of Computing, Georgia Institute of Technology

"Dream as if you'll live forever, live as if you'll die today."

-James Dean

Hello, I am Xin Zhang (prounounciation ≈ "shin chang"), a Ph.D student in computer science. I have been working with Prof. Mayur Naik in Program Analysis Group since I joined Georgia Tech in 2011. Right before that, I received my Bachelor degree in Software Engineering from Shanghai Jiao Tong University. I have broad interests in topics related to programming languages, software engineering and operation systems. For more details, please refer to Research or my CV.

Contact Information

News

June 11, 2014
Our paper On Abstraction Refinement for Program Analyses in Datalog won the Distinguished Paper Award of PLDI'14!
June 10, 2014
I presented our paper On Abstraction Refinement for Program Analyses in Datalog at PLDI'14, Edinburgh UK.
March 16, 2014
I presented our proposal Architectures and Systems for Mobile-Cloud Computing: A Workload-Driven Perspective as one of the Qualcomm Innovcation Fellowship finalists.
